body_html:
@jppgks, as Asim mentioned, an example eager GAN should be up shortly. It is fairly similar to your code, but uses GradientTape and trains G and D at the same time. There are no concrete plans of making TFGAN eager friendly in the very near future that I am aware of. @joel-shor, do you have some bandwidth to discuss potential approaches to making TFGAN eager friendly? @jppgks is willing to contribute.

Also, you can use the loss functions in TFGAN now. They are eager friendly with the exception of summaries.

Also, you can use the loss functions in TFGAN now. They are eager friendly with the exception of summaries.
body:
@jppgks, as Asim mentioned, an example eager GAN should be up shortly. It is fairly similar to your code, but uses GradientTape and trains G and D at the same time. There are no concrete plans of making TFGAN eager friendly in the very near future that I am aware of. @joel-shor, do you have some bandwidth to discuss potential approaches to making TFGAN eager friendly? @jppgks is willing to contribute. 

Also, you can use the loss functions in TFGAN now. They are eager friendly with the exception of summaries.
